Text: As politicians on corporate bankrolls continue to block hugely popular legislation, we're reminded that Citizens United is among the worst decisions in history. It corrupts our system every day. https://t.co/EExUbPb2zG

Joe Manchin and Kyrsten Sinema have received campaign contributions from at least 13 billionaires who previously donated to Trump.

It's clear whose side they're on.

Why do you appreciate unions?

I’ll start:

Weekends off
Paid vacations
Work breaks
Sick leave
Paid holidays
No child labor
Safer working conditions
Health care and retirement benefits
PSA: Workers are not losing ground due to inflation. They're losing ground because they lack bargaining power.

Starbucks just fired seven unionizing employees in Memphis.

This takes their union-busting to a whole new level.

Clearly, the company is terrified: over 65 Starbucks stores across the country have now filed for union elections.

I sat down with the baristas who started it all. https://t.co/sc3eJn6g3b

The underlying problem is not inflation. It’s corporate power. The entire American economy is concentrated into the hands of a few greedy, corporate giants with the power to raise prices.

Know the truth. https://t.co/xpmKM0ThmS

Today at 12:10pm PT, my friend @RoKhanna is joining me on Instagram Live to discuss his new book, Dignity in a Digital Age, and how to make technology work for all Americans.

I hope you'll tune in, and give this important book a read.

I’m so pleased to be able to bring you the big undergraduate course I teach — Wealth & Poverty — starting tomorrow at the link below and continuing every Friday for 14 weeks.

Don't worry. There won't be any exams.
https://t.co/6G9GFdxQc9

Forced overtime
Wage theft
Forced arbitration
Last-second scheduling
Misclassifying employees as contractors

Inflation is a sideshow. The real problem is a lopsided economic system that allows employers to exploit working people with impunity. https://t.co/tdUVC7bdBV
It’s an illusion to think we can make any major progress in this country without getting corporate money out of politics. It is the root of all evil in Washington.
Color me shocked. https://t.co/FY1AMNk7sW

In December, Nancy Pelosi dismissed banning members of Congress from trading individual stocks. She has since reversed course following immense public pressure.

There are tricky, morally complex issues. Banning congressional stock trading is not one of them. Let's get this done! https://t.co/Nbl7Csv2GL

Child poverty dropped by at least A THIRD because of the expanded Child Tax Credit.

Did we extend it and lift even more kids out of poverty? No, we did not.

Congress simply let it expire. Poof.

Poverty is a policy choice.
Don't believe wage gains are pushing up prices. Corporations are increasing their profit margins while households are being squeezed. Household debt is its highest since 2007.

This isn’t the first time Starbucks has retaliated against pro-union employees: last year, a judge for the NLRB found that Starbucks had illegally fired two Philadelphia workers for trying to unionize their store in 2019 and 2020.

The company has shown its true colors yet again.

Solidarity with these fired workers.

@SBWorkersUnited: If you weren’t making an impact, Starbucks wouldn’t be so scared of you. https://t.co/7GukriGXcr

Reform and expand the Supreme Court
Abolish the Electoral College
Grant D.C. Statehood
Give Puerto Rico self-determination
End the filibuster
Ban gerrymandering
Protect voting rights

Build a system that actually represents the people.

Do it before it’s too late.

Today’s Office Hours question: Should the Supreme Court be expanded to protect voting rights and constrain the moneyed interests? If not, how best can the asymmetry be remedied?

I'll chime in at 10am PT/1pm ET:
https://t.co/yYQtTcDThL

Instead of asking, is this good for the economy, we ought to be asking, is this good for working people?

If workers are more satisfied, they’ll be more productive. But even more fundamentally, we don’t work for the economy. The economy is supposed to work for us. https://t.co/ANXzQiKaoa

Workers are not losing ground due to inflation. They're losing ground because they lack bargaining power.

Even though the economy grew last year, the share going to workers continues to shrink.

Inflation isn't the problem. The problem is worker exploitation and corporate greed.
Starbucks’ union-busting campaign is getting more aggressive every day. Why isn't this getting more coverage? https://t.co/3QGooxmWgX
PSA: Don’t believe the corporate lies about higher prices. https://t.co/Te0Qn9WucT
Just a random reminder that tax cuts for the rich didn’t, and won’t ever, trickle down. https://t.co/gBQlFdJSbl

No, it's not radical to expand the Supreme Court. What's radical is allowing Supreme Court justices — appointed by presidents who lost the popular vote — to take away voting rights from millions of Americans.

The Roberts Supreme Court has turned democracy upside down – making it harder for the poor to vote (approving racist gerrymandering and gutting the Voting Rights Act) and easier for the rich to corrupt our system (removing all limits on campaign donations). 

So expand the Court?

Starbucks is raising prices again, blaming supply chain issues and labor costs.

Meanwhile, Starbucks CEO’s total compensation rose 39% in 2021 to $20.4 million.

Do not be fooled. This is about corporate greed. It always is.
Source: https://t.co/TJ8bzBA92g

The next time someone tells you wealth inequality isn’t a problem, hit them with this fact:

If the world’s ten richest men lost 99.999% of their wealth, they would still be richer than 99% of the global population.

In many ways, this terrible period in public life has enabled us to slow down, simplify, deepen relationships, and create more room for ourselves. Personally, I’m rediscovering an enjoyment that feels deeper and more authentic than it’s ever been. https://t.co/JGOljOMwtT

Btw, this redistricting cycle is the first in 50+ years where states with a history of discrimination don’t have to approve voting maps with the federal government.

Our window to stop them is closing rapidly.

Reform and expand the Supreme Court. Abolish the Electoral College. Grant D.C. statehood. Give Puerto Rico self-determination. End the filibuster.

I’m sorry, but there’s nothing “unfair” about making our democracy fairer.

Sandra Bland. Philando Castile. Maurice Gordon. Ronell Foster. Walter Scott. Samuel DuBose. Daunte Wright.

All were pulled over by police for traffic stops. All had their lives stolen from them.

Remove police from traffic enforcement. We can't sit back and let this continue.

PSA: Starbucks isn’t socially responsible. Its brand is built on faux social responsibility.

First, the company backtracked on vaccine-or-test plans for its baristas. Now, it's running an aggressive union-busting campaign to keep wages low.

Know the truth.

I’ve been in or around politics for over a half-century now.

I’ve watched as corporations ransacked our system.

In 1952, the corporate share of federal tax revenue was 32%. In 2020, it was down to 7%.

Here’s how we break the corporate oligarchy and return power to the people. https://t.co/AbUGFXjBLv
Public support for unions is at a 50-year high. That is a big, big deal. https://t.co/pKPgfVSOUT

Because of the expanded Child Tax Credit, child poverty dropped by at least a third.

It’s rare for a government policy to work so unambiguously well, on such a huge scale, and on so basic a problem.

So why did Congress let it expire?

The oligarchy didn’t want to pay for it.
Never forget this: Working people outnumber the billionaires and CEOs by a huge margin. If we stand in solidarity, we will win.

Big picture—how did we get here?

Forty years of deregulation, privatization, globalization, and the dominance of finance.
https://t.co/gcDghK1dVT
Prohibiting members of Congress from trading stock is a total no brainer, unless, of course, you’re an oligarch.
https://t.co/vFjyalAqhb

While Republicans in Congress were talking about trickle down tax cuts, Joe Biden and Democrats in Congress took action to save the American economy. Their efforts have kept millions out of poverty and got Americans back to work. https://t.co/n3hdHnaToR
Pshhh… workers are always essential…
So let me get this straight: Jeff Bezos can afford to widen a port to fit his yacht, but Amazon can’t afford to let workers unionize.
We live in a two-tiered society with socialism for the wealthy and corporations and cold hard capitalism for everyone else.

I’m so pleased to be able to bring you the big undergraduate course I teach on Wealth and Poverty — starting here next Friday and continuing every Friday for 14 weeks. I’ll also post an abbreviated syllabus so you can do the key readings, should you wish. https://t.co/6G9GFdxQc9
Cartoon by Drew Sheneman. https://t.co/6opuP2rY58

According to the Republican Party, sending lawmakers running for their lives and chanting about hanging the Vice President is simply “legitimate political discourse.”

Democrats must take this threat seriously — before there's no democracy left to protect. https://t.co/zxpWATTXcq
Today, the GOP showed us exactly who they really are.
A special heartfelt thank you to the U.S. postal workers who work tirelessly to deliver everything our country needs, and keep us all connected. We owe you all a great deal of gratitude.
Another week has gone by, and members of Congress are still using insider information to trade stocks. How on Earth is this still legal?

Starbucks calls its baristas “partners.” Baloney.

Between Jan-Sept, 2021, Starbucks revenue soared to $21 billion.

Its president and CEO raked in $14,665,575.

Yet the average pay at Starbucks is just $14/hour.

How can you be partners if you don’t share in the profits?
Solidarity! https://t.co/GmeMaAKaEr

Today, ballots will be mailed out for the redo union election at an Amazon warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama.

If the union succeeds this time around, it will be a watershed moment for the labor movement — and a crucial step towards rebuilding worker power. https://t.co/ECwd6A36fX

I fear today’s jobs report will heighten fears that a so-called “tight” labor market is fueling inflation, and that therefore the Fed must put on the brakes by raising interest rates.

This line of reasoning is utter rubbish, and it's bad news for workers. https://t.co/Y0S0bt2Hmo

All across the country, labor is taking their power back at the picket line.

10,000 John Deere workers. 1,000 Alabama coal miners. New York City taxi drivers. Health care workers. Starbucks baristas. So many more.

Worker power is on the rise. There is no doubt about it.
Nothing says tax the rich like Jeff Bezos having a historic bridge in Rotterdam dismantled so his $500-million superyacht can pass through.

Forgive me for sounding like a broken record, but I can't stress this enough: There is no “labor shortage." There’s a shortage of good jobs paying adequate wages.

The last thing working people need is for the Fed to raise interest rates right now. https://t.co/Y0S0btkiKY
Texans shouldn’t have to worry that their power is going to fail just because their governor is sold out to big energy companies. The Lone Star State deserves better than Greg Abbott.

You would think the “party of free speech” would have a problem with 14 states imposing restrictions on how teachers can talk about race.

(You would be wrong.)
You know what's even better than calling workers essential? Paying them essential wages.

"The right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of race, color, or previous condition of servitude."

This was the promise of the 15th Amendment, made 152 years ago today. We must keep it. https://t.co/7UZmkdgXxz

No free speech for teachers.

No free speech for protestors.

No free speech for voters.

Apparently the only free speech the GOP supports is corporate money in our democracy. https://t.co/5ielRimdyw

Something big is brewing at Starbucks right now. Its workers have filed to unionize at over 50 stores across 19 states. It’s spreading like wildfire. Meanwhile, Starbucks’ union-busting campaign is getting more aggressive every day. Why isn't this getting more coverage?

My advice to Democratic politicians: Stand up for unions. Fight to strengthen them. Join workers on picket lines. Don’t let the GOP pretend they’re the party of the working class when they’re a trojan horse for moneyed interests. Show us that you're not. https://t.co/hVIIpdByPm
Wealthy corporations and their enablers have spread 5 big lies about unions in order to stop workers from organizing — and protect their own bottom-lines. Know the truth. https://t.co/wTE1H8TY4g
Unionize Amazon! https://t.co/XORBUvkGzV

The midterm elections are just over nine months away. What will Democrats run on? What will Republicans run on?

One hint came at a Houston-area Trump rally Saturday night. https://t.co/hc4oMvPCS9
Your mid-week reminder that trickle down economics is nothing more than a cruel hoax designed to enrich the wealthy and corporations at the expense of the American people.

In December, Nancy Pelosi dismissed banning members of Congress from trading individual stocks.

In January, she reversed course following immense public pressure.

We have momentum, folks. We can ban this corruption once and for all.

Let's keep the pressure on. https://t.co/CEqF96e9pN

No reason to sugarcoat this. If Dems fail to pass voting protections before the midterms, the GOP is going to gerrymander their way into power across the country.

They may not give it up for decades.

14 states have put limits on teaching about the nation's racial past.

81 anti-protest bills have been introduced in 34 states.

440 voter suppression bills have been introduced in 29 states.

And you say the GOP is the “party of free speech”?

Who else is tired of progress getting blocked over, and over, and over, and over…?

Washington is stuck in an endless loop. But there is a way out.

If Bill Murray can escape his loop, so can we. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/Pnu4nf6E7w

Sec 3 of the 14th Amendment — the Disqualification Clause — bars anyone from holding office in the US who “engaged in insurrection” against the US government.

So how do we get this clause to stop Trump’s rerun for President? Let's discuss today at 10am PT:https://t.co/HW70ufQk5l

Nobody complains about the deficit when:

-We give $8T to the military
-We pass $1.9T in tax cuts
-We give subsidies to Big Oil, Big Banks, and Big Pharma

Everybody complains about the deficit when:

-We try to help working people

Almost as if it’s not about the deficit at all. https://t.co/kpxgJIftim

Over 50 Starbucks stores across the country have filed for union elections in the past month.

Unsurprisingly, @Starbucks is deploying the same old anti-union playbook and telling their workers lies about unions.

Know the truth, and don't fall for their corporate propaganda. https://t.co/3Tk3rQ7JPO
Make no mistake: These 52 senators are enabling billion-dollar drug companies to raise drug prices in the middle of a global pandemic. A moral outrage. https://t.co/VIs2KjrLvF

In just the first month of 2022, drugmakers have raised the prices of prescription drugs by 6.6%.

Rather than take on Big Pharma's greed, two corporate Democrats and 50 Senate Republicans would rather block Build Back Better and line their own pockets with Big Pharma cash.
The Great Gatsby was required reading in my high school. I have to admit I never read it. Had it been banned, I probably would have devoured it. https://t.co/Fk2kMUypJ0

The monopolization of America, in a nutshell:

Greedy corporations don’t have to compete.

Which means they can – and do – jack up your prices.

Local labor markets become dominated by a few big employers.

Exploited workers can’t get a raise because there’s nowhere else to work.

I keep hearing “voting rights are dead.” None of us should accept that.

This should go without saying, but we cannot afford to give up on the fundamental right to vote.
The “True Starbucks Experience” sure looks a whole lot like intimidating your employees out of exercising their right to form a union. https://t.co/qu4Q63wcgf

When we spend $8 trillion on defense, nobody cares about the deficit.

When we pass a $1.9 trillion tax cut, nobody cares about the deficit.

But when we try to pass legislation that would actually help working people, the deficit suddenly becomes a problem. https://t.co/0RvQv2nmTj
Source: https://t.co/TJ8bzBhZO8
FYI: The richest 1% emit more than 2x as much CO2 as the bottom 50% of the world. Isn't it time we stop framing the climate crisis around the individual responsibility of regular people?
Shh don’t tell right-wingers, but there’s no better way to get a teenager to read a book than to ban it. https://t.co/Fk2kMUQ17A
If you think 2021 was the year workers got fed up and flexed their collective muscle, just wait until you see what working people will accomplish in 2022.

I’ve talked with Gingrich several times in the last few decades. I always come away with the impression of a military general in an age where bombast and explosive ideas are more potent than bombs. https://t.co/9LzYxFCjrF

Solidarity with every Starbucks store making history right now.

The effort is clearly making the coffee giant nervous: workers at a Mesa, AZ store report being barraged with anti-union texts urging workers to vote no. The people are with you, @SBWorkersUnited. Keep up the fight!

Friends, the speed at which Starbucks stores are filing for union elections in a heavily under-unionized industry is major. And don’t lose sight of the fact that this effort is being led by young people. 

Among all the doom and gloom, we can always find hope in worker power. https://t.co/ALK3YvJ02d

A living wage. Housing as a human right. Medicare for All. Building union power. Legalizing marijuana & expunging records. Tackling the climate crisis.

This is what @ninaturner has always been about.

I'm proud to endorse her run for Congress. https://t.co/JmEzYUdUfP

There is no more left vs right. It’s now democracy vs authoritarianism, voting rights vs white supremacy.

We cannot afford to give up on voting rights. Here are 8 ways we can still protect them: https://t.co/lHAvZTrIjI

Don’t let the media and pundit class fool you into thinking the Democrats have gone too far left. It's corporate hogwash.

88% of Americans want to lower drug prices. 84% want to expand Medicare. 73% support paid family and medical leave.

The filibuster is blocking all of it. https://t.co/xQX3pZec3I

2013: “Things have changed dramatically in the South." - John Roberts, when he gutted the Voting Rights Act

2022: https://t.co/0Mj6nIpQyv

Good afternoon. Instigators of the Jan 6 insurrection still need to be expelled from Congress: Ted Cruz, Josh Hawley, Andy Biggs, Paul Gosar, Louie Gohmert...

They tried to overthrow the results of the election and incited a mob to attack the Capitol. What more needs to be said?
This is just incredible to witness. https://t.co/bG3yAa8ajd
The January 6th insurrection was not the finale - it was the warm up. 19 states passed laws restricting voting access in 2021. The assault on our democracy is in full gear at this very moment.

Newt Gingrich can be mean, but his meanness is that of a nasty kid rather than a tyrant. And like all nasty kids, inside is an insecure little fellow who desperately wants attention.
https://t.co/9LzYxFTUQf

Whomever Biden nominates to the Supreme Court she must be committed to overturning Citizens United.
